reviews.review_msg: There was no lecture. Only readings. The "lecture" was spent going over past assignments and group presentations. She rambles and gets lost in her own work. The assigs were full of mistakes even though they were copied and she often didn't know what was on them.Grading criteria was often ignored or incorrect. Impossible to learn.
Easiest 2 classes I have done, went in one single time to class to do a presentation.
Very fun course all in all. Made me rethink how I look at the world and the role linguistics plays in every aspect.

She's really nice & kind. However, a bit boring. She reads off the slides which are directly off the textbook. Sometimes it gets confusing. The course w/ her isn't hard. I'm grabbing A's by just reading & taking my own notes from the textbook. If youre willing to teach yourself & have easy tests this is the course for you. I'm taking 481 w/ her too
It's hilarious when she loses track of where she was in the book and has to look OVER her glasses and be practically flush with the page to see. They're called bifocals, Nancy! :P

I've taken both 322 and 324 from her. She is very nice and reasonable. The tests are quite difficult, but if you study, you will manage. She gives very good notes but the lectures are boring. Overall, she is an excellent professor.

I've taken her classes twice, both 222 and 322. Her notes are very organized and clear. Her tests are fair and she always prepare you for the test well in advance (eg. give you sample questions and tips) Also, she's very nice during her office hours. I would say she is the nicest ling prof @ sfu so far.

Nice guy and willing to help. However, he doesn't explain the material well and is highly disorganized in his class. You'll get confuse just listening to him and he keeps repeating and pondering over things that has nothing to do with the material. I have a hard time just listening to him speak. TAKE WITH ANOTHER PROF IF YOU CAN!

He is a nice guy that clearly cares for his students, but his lectures are just too slow and disorganized. It takes him 2 weeks to go over material that you can learn in one afternoon. His exams have two versions, not sure how fair it is. For a 300lvl course, the assignments and exams are fairly easy and the course isn't too time-consuming.

Kyeong-min is a great professor. The semester sometimes starts out a but slowly but Kyeong-min is always available if you need extra help and if you are willing to put in the effort then so is he! He really cares about his students and wants everyone to succeed.

Although Kyeong-min is extremely kind and is obviously passionate about syntax, his lectures and notes are just not there. Its impossible to follow along in class because he frequently gets distracted. Our class didnt even manage to finish the entire semesters worth of material.

Kyeong-min was a fantastic prof. He made sure everyone understood each topic before moving on. It is easy to get lost in Syntax, but I felt that he was always willing to go the extra mile to help students understand and succeed. His exams are easy if you study the slides and complete homework assignments. I would highly recommend Kyeong-min!

Kyeongmin lacks confidence during his lectures. He's very slow and is unclear at times. His notes are also messy and hard to read. I had to teach myself because I just couldn't understand his lectures. His exams were also very hard. He would give us assignments that were VERY different from the exams. I personally wouldn't take this prof again.
He is so loud. He'll be super quiet and then become super loud out of nowhere and it's scary. He also takes attendance in a 300 level class. He is unclear and treats us like we are in high school.

Professor Kim is fantastic. He is everything you could want in a professor - clear in his expectation, caring of his students, and an enthusiastic lecturer. Syntax is a pretty dry subject, but he manages to keep lectures engaging, and he goes above and beyond in creating amazing exam guides and materials to help you succeed. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Really clear and helpful with an boring subject. Always encouraged and answered questions.  Way too many assignments to hand in, however these did prepare me for the take home exams.  Exams were difficult and tricky but all the answers were found in the textbook or readings.

ive taken LING 222 and 322 with him and i love him! hes one of the best profs in LING, and his courses are all GPA boosters. his lectures are very clear and easy to understand. attendance is mandatory as you have to hand in the homework every week, and the homework actually takes some time, but they definitely help you to do better in exams

Definitely a great lecturer and really caring about his students. His tests/quizzes are fair and don't contain any trick questions - what is talked about in class is what you will need to know. For the entire course, I only consulted the textbook a handful of times. Put in a bit of effort and you can do well in this course.

Keir's course isn't textbook-heavy. That's good, because the author tries too hard to be the reader's friend, and explains concepts in annoying ways. Keir, however, is not annoying. Lectures are engaging. Exams and quizzes are fair. Few tricks up this guy's sleeve, except wanting the students to understand the building blocks of generative syntax.
A great prof that is great at teaching. Creates good examples and is a funny and nice person. Lectures and lecture notes are easy to understand.

Super nice woman. She's very enthusiastic about Syntax, but unfortunately she's not always the clearest explainer. However, if you go to her office hours, she's very helpful. Her exams aren't easy, but they are fair.
